item.title: Positioning buttons with the GridBagLayout, Help
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Well, The gridbag layout positions buttons on the JFrame were you want, normally i use netbeans but i want a more organized code. Well, your suppose to draw you you JFrame how you want, so i did a simple test.

I simply drew out the sections, in X3 and Y4 i tried to position a button using this:

addItem(panel1, new JButton("cancel"), 3, 4, 1, 1, GridBagConstraints.EAST);

And i have this method to resolve it:

private void addItem(JPanel p, JComponent c, int x, int y, in width, int height, int align)
{
GridbagConstraints gc = new GridBagConstraints();
gc.gridx = x
gc.gridy = y
gc.gridwidth = width;
gc.gridheight = height;
gc.weightx = 100.0;
gc.weighty = 100.0;
gc.insets = new insets(5, 5, 5, 5);
gc.anchor = align;
gc.fill = GridBagConstraints.NONE;
p.add(c, gc);
}

And the buttons showed up in the middle west:

| |
| |
| BUTTON |
| |
| |
|___________________|

Whats wrong?
